description: Group the natural numbers into blocks: B_1 = 1, B_2 = 2,3,4, B_3 = 5,6,7,8,9, ..., each block ending in a square. Permute each block B_k by beginning with the central term, followed by the transposed symmetric pairs from B_k.
comments: A permutation of the natural numbers.
references: S. G. Krantz and J. D. McNeal, Creating more convergent series, Amer. Math. Monthly, 111 (No. 1, 2004), 32-38.
links: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: The k-th term of the n-th block is T(n, k) = n^2-n+1+(-1)^k*floor(k/2), k=1..2*n-1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 16 2004
mathematica: pb[c_]:=Module[{len=(Length[c]-1)/2},Flatten[Join[{c[[len+1]]}, Thread[ {Take[c,-len],Reverse[Take[c,len]]}]]]] ; Flatten[pb/@ Table[Range[ (n-1)^2+1,n^2],{n,10}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 18 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 16 2004
